result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth A Watkins

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 10:50 am.

10:53 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Atty Dan Johns appears, def FTA, Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Per Atty Johns, has not been able to contact def re hearing.  Vic rts complied with.  Plea offer to be sent out.  Parties request 1 week adjournment.  11/8 for STC at 9:40 a.m.  Court wants def to appear via Zoom video or in person.  Adj.  10:56 a.m.  klr
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 11, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 09:20 AM Defendant Kenneth A Watkins in court with attorney Daniel W Johns.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comp rcvd/def waives reading.  Def waives T/L only for prelim.  Def understands.  PTC to be set for 7/5 at 2:30.  Vic rts complied with initially.  Def does not need to appear at PTC.  Def needs to be fingerprinted and booked per Court.  Adj.  9:22 a.m.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:21 a.m.  Court calls case.  Def appears in person.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Def appeared once before.  Was to contact public def.  Def states he doesn't qualify for public def.  Court swears def in to question re income/assets.  Court explains process if court appoints atty.  Def understands.  Court sets AIA for 6/20 at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  9:26 a.m.  klr

5/2/22 Notes: STC:  Court calls case.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Def also appears.   State given a continuance with initial appearance date on 5/16 at 9:00 a.m.   Def is out on bond.  If Christine Watkins contacts DA, may request bond change.  Court questions def re income for atty appointment.  Def was declined for public def appt.  Def states Christine wants to come back up here.  Court explains court appointment process.  Form provided to def.  Adj.  9:18 a.m.  klr

WATKINS, KENNETH A.:  04/11/22 Bond hearing minutes:  1:31 p.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  1:32 p.m.  Lt. Foryan sworn in, direct by DA.  Right to atty explaine, public def info provided.  Officer identifies def.  Incident took place in Hurley, IC.  Court questions officer.  Court finds PC.  Court explaines PC to def.  Def understands.  DA requests no contact with Vic and $5,000 cash requested.  Court questions DA re def's ties to community.  Questions def.  Def asks if he can address the court.  Def requests bond to be lowered to $3,000.  Court questions further re ties to community.   Def indicates needs meds and to take care of animals.  Court sets $3,000 cash/$7,000 sig bond.  No contact with alleged vic or girlfriend, K.W.  Initial to be set for 5/2 at 9:00 a.m.  Court explains bond conditions.  Adj.  1:44 p.m.  klr
